actions.in_committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to Subcommittee on Social Security.

official_title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to remove permanently the 3 percent threshold requirement for cost-of-living increases.
subjects: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

summary.text: Cost-of-Living Adjustment Reform Act of 1986 - Amends title II (Old Age, Survivors and Disability Insurance) of the Social Security Act to replace the requirement that there be at least a three-percent rise in the Consumer Price Index before a cost-of-living adjustment of benefits is made with a requirement that such an adjustment be made whenever the cost of living increase is greater than zero.

titles.title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to remove permanently the 3 percent threshold requirement for cost-of-living increases.
